title: Relates to penalties for the illegal shipment of cigarettes
summary: Relates to penalties for the illegal shipment of cigarettes and the authority of state and local authorities to bring actions to recover civil fines for such violations.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  DINOWITZ,  MAGEE, GOTTFRIED, GALEF, MILLMAN,

       AN  ACT  to  amend the public health law, in relation to the shipment of
         cigarettes

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivisions  1, 2 and 5 of section 1399-ll of the public
    2  health law, as added by chapter 262 of the laws of 2000, are amended  to
    3  read as follows:
    4    1.  It  shall  be  unlawful  for any person engaged in the business of
    5  selling cigarettes to ship or cause to be shipped any cigarettes to  any
    6  person  in  this  state who is not: (a) a person licensed as a cigarette
    7  tax agent or wholesale dealer under article twenty of  the  tax  law  or
    8  registered  retail dealer under section four hundred eighty-a of the tax
    9  law; (b) an export warehouse proprietor pursuant to chapter  52  of  the
   10  internal  revenue  code  or  an  operator  of a customs bonded warehouse
   11  pursuant to section 1311 or 1555 of title 19 of the United States  Code;
   12  or  (c)  a  person  who  [is] PRESENTS HIMSELF OR HERSELF AS an officer,
   13  employee or agent of the United  States  government,  this  state  or  a
   14  department,  agency,  instrumentality  or  political  subdivision of the
   15  United States or this state, when such person is  acting  in  accordance
   16  with  his  or  her  official duties. For purposes of this subdivision, a
   17  person is a licensed or registered agent or dealer  described  in  para-
   18  graph  (a)  of  this subdivision if his or her name appears on a list of
   19  licensed or registered agents or dealers published by the department  of
   20  taxation  and finance, or if such person is licensed or registered as an
   21  agent or dealer under article twenty of the tax law.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04477-01-1

       A. 1589                             2

    1    2. It shall be unlawful for any common or contract carrier to knowing-
    2  ly transport cigarettes to any person in this state reasonably  believed
    3  by  such  carrier  to be other than a person described in paragraph (a),
    4  (b) or (c) of subdivision one of  this  section.  For  purposes  of  the
    5  preceding  sentence,  if  cigarettes  are transported to a home or resi-
    6  dence, it shall be presumed that the common  or  contract  carrier  knew
    7  that such person was not a person described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c)
    8  of  subdivision  one of this section. It shall be unlawful for any other
    9  person to knowingly transport cigarettes to any person  in  this  state,
   10  other  than to a person described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of subdi-
   11  vision one of  this  section.  Nothing  in  this  subdivision  shall  be
   12  construed  to  prohibit a person other than a common or contract carrier
   13  OR A PERSON ENGAGED IN THE BUSINESS OF SELLING  CIGARETTES  from  trans-
   14  porting  not  more  than eight hundred cigarettes at any one time to any
   15  person in this state.
   16    5. Any person who violates the provisions of subdivision one or two of
   17  this section shall be guilty of a class A misdemeanor and for  a  second
   18  or subsequent violation shall be guilty of a class E felony. In addition
   19  to  the criminal penalty, [the commissioner may impose a civil fine] ANY
   20  PERSON WHO VIOLATES THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION ONE, TWO OR  THREE  OF
   21  THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE  SUBJECT  TO  A CIVIL PENALTY not to exceed THE
   22  GREATER OF (A) five thousand dollars for each  such  violation  [on  any
   23  person  who violates subdivision one or two of this section. The commis-
   24  sioner may impose a civil fine not to exceed five thousand  dollars  for
   25  each  violation  of  subdivision  three  of  this  section on any person
   26  engaged in the business of selling cigarettes who ships or causes to  be
   27  shipped  any  such  cigarettes  to any person in this state]; OR (B) ONE
   28  HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR EACH  PACK  OF  CIGARETTES  SHIPPED,  CAUSED  TO  BE
   29  SHIPPED OR TRANSPORTED IN VIOLATION OF SUCH SUBDIVISION.
   30    S 2. Section 1399-ll of the public health law, as added by chapter 262
   31  of the laws of 2000, is amended by adding a new subdivision 6 to read as
   32  follows:
   33    6. THE ATTORNEY GENERAL MAY BRING AN ACTION TO RECOVER THE CIVIL FINES
   34  PROVIDED  BY  SUBDIVISION FIVE OF THIS SECTION AND FOR SUCH OTHER RELIEF
   35  AS MAY BE DEEMED NECESSARY. IN ADDITION, THE CORPORATION COUNSEL OF  ANY
   36  POLITICAL  SUBDIVISION  THAT  IMPOSES  A  TAX ON CIGARETTES MAY BRING AN
   37  ACTION TO RECOVER THE CIVIL PENALTIES PROVIDED BY  SUBDIVISION  FIVE  OF
   38  THIS  SECTION  AND FOR SUCH OTHER RELIEF AS MAY BE DEEMED NECESSARY WITH
   39  RESPECT TO ANY CIGARETTES SHIPPED, CAUSED TO BE SHIPPED  OR  TRANSPORTED
   40  IN VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION TO ANY PERSON LOCATED WITHIN SUCH POLITICAL
   41  SUBDIVISION.  ALL  CIVIL  FINES  OBTAINED  IN  ANY  SUCH ACTION SHALL BE
   42  RETAINED BY THE STATE OR MUNICIPALITY  BRINGING  SUCH  ACTION,  PROVIDED
   43  THAT  NO  PERSON  SHALL  BE  REQUIRED TO PAY CIVIL PENALTIES TO BOTH THE
   44  STATE AND A POLITICAL SUBDIVISION WITH RESPECT TO THE SAME VIOLATION  OF
   45  THIS SECTION.
   46    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
